history.content: The policy for CS is not yet decided, because CS is housed as the EECS department in COE, so things are TBD.

children.subject:
In regular policy, 16b is not counted towards the declaration gpa at all, only 61a, 61b, and 70 are, meaning you would need a B+ in cs70 in order to meet the declaration GPA (or possibly be able to declare through a petition with a B).

The policy for this year is likely to change due to the PNP happenings. As in the student answer, you need to wait for the official word to make any decisions, but you can take the Spring 2020 policies to see a possible policy: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs-lowerdiv.
That semester had default PNP unlike now, so assuming the same policy will be in place and extrapolating a little bit, it looks to me that you would be able to exclude the 61a grade from the declaration and then use either 16b or cs70 grade for cs70 in your declaration gpa. This would mean that the average is taken between the 2 courses 61b and 70/16b, and you would be able to declare with a B- in at least one of cs70 or 16b, as long as you don't fail cs70.

history.content:
Hi,

My situation: I have a B- in 61a and an A in 61b which means my CS major gpa is 3.35. I am taking cs70 and eecs16b currently. I think either class grade can be used for my final CS major gpa. However, in light of the new P/NP policy for L & S. I want to Pass cs70 &/or eecs16b so that only my 61a grade and 61b grade are taken into account for the major and hence, I will qualify for CS because the gpa is > 3.3. How do things change for the CS major now that LS is P/NP? Can I do what I said I wanted to do and will it work the way I said it will? Do I pass eecs16b and cs70 or just 1 of them (Maybe I pass cs70 but take 16b for letter grade and they count 16b towards my gpa or vice versa)? Will they count my grades in cs70/eecs16b regardless of P/NP?

Thanks in advance!
history.subject: CS Major
